cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest then turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana/Mississippi)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning east of Ocean Springs, MS to Indian Pass, FL; Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to Ocean Springs, MS
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands may bring brief gusts near tropical-storm force, but sustained TS winds are unlikely (≤5% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay, but values above 3 ft are not expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could drop 1–3 inches of rain through Monday; widespread flooding not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along west-central Florida beaches; low-end tornado risk remains well northwest of the port.
